description.narrative: The proposed project is a key urban environmental initiative of Wuhan municipal government (WMG) with nationwide demonstration potential. The project will help WMG to (i) design and implement sustainable solutions for the management of wastewater treatment plant (WWTP) sludge, including its energy recovery and reuse of biosolids; (ii) improve water quality in urban lakes and water channels; (iii) reestablish water circulation and improve resilience to floods; (iv) improve the environment, living conditions, and public health standards; and (v) enhance public awareness of urban environmental and related public health issues.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Integrated wastewater sludge treatment and disposal, and urban water resource management in Wuhan Municipality

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
a. More than 50% of urban WWTP sludge will be treated and disposed of in an economically and environmentally sustainable way by 2018, extending landfill life

description.narrative: Integrated wastewater sludge treatment and disposal, and urban water resource management in Wuhan Municipality

title.narrative: c. Improvement of operation and maintenance performance of WWTPs will decrease inorganic matter in the sludge by 25% by 2018

description.narrative: Integrated wastewater sludge treatment and disposal, and urban water resource management in Wuhan Municipality

title.narrative: e. The frequency of disruption and damage caused by local storm water flooding is reduced by more than 50% in Wuhan New Zone by 2018

description.narrative: Integrated wastewater sludge treatment and disposal, and urban water resource management in Wuhan Municipality
